units.name: Peasant
units.desc: The backbone of the realm. Their hands are calloused, and their loyalty is bought with bread and safety.

units.name: Foreman
units.desc: Armed with blueprints and a loud voice, they turn chaotic construction sites into architectural triumphs.

units.name: Stone Mason
units.desc: They speak the language of the earth. No stone is too heavy, and no mountain is too stubborn for their tools.

units.name: Militia
units.desc: Brave souls with wooden clubs and a few days of training. They aren't legends yet, but they stand their ground.

units.name: Shield Maiden
units.desc: An unbreakable wall of iron and willpower. Where she stands, the line never breaks.

units.name: Vanguard Ranger
units.desc: Ghost-like scouts who live for the thrill of the hunt. They strike and vanish before the enemy can even blink.

units.name: Imperial Knight
units.desc: A juggernaut of polished steel. The thunder of their charge is the last thing many enemies ever hear.

units.name: Berserker
units.desc: Fuelled by rage and disregard for their own safety. They are a whirlwind of blades that ends only when everything is still.

units.name: Stone Golem
units.desc: An ancient mountain given legs and a singular, crushing purpose. Siege weapons in sentient form.

units.name: Shortbowman
units.desc: Quick to fire and cheap to arm. Quantity is its own quality when the sky turns dark with arrows.

units.name: Crossbow Specialist
units.desc: A master of mechanical lethality. No amount of plate armor can stop a bolt fired with such precision.

units.name: Longbow Hunter
units.desc: They can hit a falling leaf from across a valley. For them, distance is just a suggestion.

units.name: Fire Archer
units.desc: Some just want to watch the world burn. These archers carry the matches.

units.name: Arcane Scholar
units.desc: Young mages who have spent more time with books than people. Their sparks are small, but they bite.

units.name: Storm Invoker
units.desc: They don't just predict the weather; they command it. A conduit for the heavens' fury.

units.name: Necromancer
units.desc: Master of the threshold between life and death. They take from the fallen to mend the living.

units.name: Cryomancer
units.desc: The air chills in their presence. They turn the heat of battle into a frozen graveyard.

units.name: Royal Guard
units.desc: The Sovereign's chosen. Their armor is a symbol of status; their blade is a symbol of absolute authority.

units.name: Poison Saboteur
units.desc: Victory through chemistry. A single scratch from their dart ensures a slow, agonizing end.

units.name: Battle Priest
units.desc: Prayer in one hand, mace in the other. They heal the soul and break the body.

structures.name: Stronghold
structures.desc: The beating heart of your territory. It provides safety, gathers coin, and serves as the seat of your power.

structures.name: Infirmary
structures.desc: A sanctuary for the broken. Smelling of herbs and clean linen, it is where soldiers return to fight another day.

structures.name: Gold Mine Shaft
structures.desc: A dark descent into the earth's veins. The deeper we dig, the more the coffers overflow.

structures.name: Farm Estate
structures.desc: Rows of golden grain and the smell of fresh earth. Peace is found in the harvest.

structures.name: Quarry Mill
structures.desc: The relentless sound of stone hitting stone. It provides the heavy blocks needed for true civilization.

structures.name: Sawmill
structures.desc: Great blades turning through ancient trunks. The forest falls to build the future.

structures.name: Barracks
structures.desc: Where farmhands are forged into warriors through sweat, steel, and discipline.

structures.name: Stables
structures.desc: The air is thick with the scent of hay and powerful beasts. Speed is born here.

structures.name: Archery Range
structures.desc: A place of silence and focus. Every thud of an arrow in a target is a promise of a future kill.

structures.name: Mystic Spire
structures.desc: A tower that pierces the clouds. It hums with a power that common folk find terrifying.

structures.name: Workshop
structures.desc: Gears, grease, and greatness. This is where the heavy machines and artificial life are brought to life.

structures.name: Wood Wall
structures.desc: Simple sharpened logs. It won't stop a dragon, but it keeps the wolves at bay.

structures.name: Stone Wall
structures.desc: An enduring testament to safety. Cold, hard, and utterly indifferent to enemy blades.

structures.name: Watchtower
structures.desc: A bird's-eye view of the battlefield. The first to see the storm, and the first to strike.

structures.name: Ballista Tower
structures.desc: A massive bolt-thrower that turns charging cavalry into mere pin-cushions.

structures.name: Mana Obelisk
structures.desc: A crystalline resonator that fires beams of pure magical energy. Science or sorcery? Only the target knows.

structures.name: Fence
structures.desc: A polite way of telling the enemy they aren't welcome. Easily broken, but surprisingly annoying.

structures.name: Gatehouse
structures.desc: The only way in, and the only way out. A bottleneck designed for slaughter.

structures.name: Spike Trap
structures.desc: Watch your step. Hidden beneath the soil, it delivers a very sharp welcome to intruders.

structures.name: Monolith
structures.desc: An ancient, immovable relic. It doesn't fight back, but it will outlast the stars themselves.

animals.name: Deer
animals.desc: Graceful and skittish. They are the silent ghosts of the forest, providing lean meat for those quick enough to catch them.

animals.name: Wild Boar
animals.desc: A stubborn mound of muscle and coarse fur. They generally mind their own business, but they don't take kindly to being poked.

animals.name: Sheep
animals.desc: Fluffy, dim-witted, and utterly defenseless. A walking cloud of wool and mutton.

animals.name: Great Elk
animals.desc: The majestic king of the woods. Its antlers are like a crown of oak, and its meat can feed a small village for a week.

animals.name: Hare
animals.desc: A nervous blur of ears and luck. Hard to hit, but a welcome snack for a hungry scout.

world_history: In the Era of the Empty Void, the gods were tidy, dignified beings who spent eons grooming their nebulae and polishing the stars. This era of cleanliness ended abruptly during the 'Feast of the Infinite,' when Malphas, the God of Consumption, mistakenly ingested a spicy, fermented supernova. The resulting internal pressure was more than a divine constitution could bear. In a moment of sheer, undignified desperation, Malphas bypassed the celestial gates and 'released' a massive, steaming torrent of raw, unprocessed reality into the void. This was the first Jarat—a chaotic, high-viscosity mass of matter that the other gods immediately tried to flush into the abyss. However, the mass was too dense, too stubborn, and far too 'sticky' to be removed from the fabric of space-time.

The first humans did not evolve; they were accidentally 'trapped' in the spill. These early ancestors were actually celestial janitors sent by the other deities to scrub the mess away. Armed with divine plungers and cosmic mops, they descended into the Bowel Bottoms. But as they worked, they realized the sludge was surprisingly fertile. They discovered that if they planted seeds in the warm, brown earth, crops grew at a terrifying rate. The janitors eventually traded their mops for hoes, deciding that living in a divine accident was better than working a 9-to-5 in a sterile heaven. They built the first Strongholds out of 'Two-Ply Timber' and learned to coexist with the Jarat Eaters, the world’s natural sanitation crew.

The gods, horrified that their janitors had started a civilization in a literal waste-bin, began the 'Great Scrubbing.' They sent down 'The Eraser Monoliths' and freezing blasts of energy to try and sanitize the realm, creating the Cryo-Stasis Rim. The humans, however, proved as stubborn as the land itself. They developed RTS tactics (Rapid Toilet-site Stabilization) to fortify their villages against the gods' attempts to 'flush' them. This led to a stalemate: the gods continue to look down in disgust, occasionally sending 'Night-Phase Contractions' to purge the world, while the humans of Jarat continue to build, farm, and expand, treating the divine's greatest embarrassment as their greatest inheritance.

Today, the world exists in a state of 'Constant Churn.' The interactions between the divine and the mortal have become a cycle of rejection and persistence. Humans have learned to harness the 'Pulse' of the world's biology to power their Mystic Spires, while the gods have largely given up on deletion, opting instead to occasionally toss 'Celestial Deodorant' (snowstorms) or 'Divine Fiber' (meteors) at the planet. The Age of Jarat is now defined by the 'Sovereign Remnant,' a faction of humans who believe that if they build a big enough army, they can eventually march up the Great Drain and demand an apology from Malphas himself.

biomes.name: The Bowel Bottoms
biomes.description: The site of the original 'Release.' The soil is soft, warm, and highly productive, but the air carries a heavy, unmistakable musk of antiquity.

biomes.name: The Petrified Pulp Forest
biomes.description: Where the divine janitors abandoned their cleaning supplies. The trees are tall, white rolls of absorbent wood that are excellent for soak-up-based defenses.

biomes.name: The Porcelain Sea
biomes.description: A cold, sterile ocean of white tile and blue chemical water. It is the gods' attempt at a 'clean' zone, inhabited by aggressive, bleached predators.

biomes.name: The Constipated Peaks
biomes.description: Mountain ranges formed during the gods' most difficult attempts to purge the world. Hard, grey, and completely immovable without heavy siege equipment.
